title: How smart were Albert Einstein’s children? - Quora

response.answer_text: If “smart” means just an IQ, I have to disappoint you: none of them has been tested. If “smart” describes their talents and gifts, both boys were undoubtedly very gifted people. The older son realized his talents by becoming a world-renowned expert in hydraulic engineering. The life of the younger one, an excellent musician with a particular gift for language, was spoiled by miserably treated schizophrenia and a quite unfavorable life situation. Unfortunately, most authors who feel called to report about his life, mainly spread legends.

His first born, Lieserl, died of scarlet fever or was adopted. No one knows for sure. He had two sons, Hans Albert and Eduard. Eduard was a Med student but developed schizophrenia and was institutionalized. Hans Albert was brilliant and became a professor of hydraulic engineering at UC Berkeley. They inherited their parents IQ but inheriting a trait is a tricky thing. Like eye color or hair loss, it can go through generational changes and can be less or more as you go down the line. My grandfather had a full head of hair when he died at 92 but most of my uncles are bald or mostly bald.
